text: Amador Aguirar (1904–1991) was the founder of Banco Bradesco. Amador was born in a poor family in Sao Paulo and had 12 siblings. He founded the company in 1943. Following his death, his widow had a court battle with his adopted daughters over the inheritance. The daughters Lia and Lina Aguiar eventually won the case and became billionaires. == References == Category:1904 births Category:1991 deaths Category:Brazilian business executives Category:People from São Paulo
